definition: 100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]

sentences.english: How to defense collusive attack is the key problems for the designing of fingerprinting.
sentences.chinese: 所以设计指纹算法的关键问题是如何防范合谋攻击。

sentences.english: They were charged only with conspiring to act as unregistered foreign agents.
sentences.chinese: 他们仅仅被指控合谋运作了未注册的外国机构。

sentences.english: Ms. Hoxie has been charged with wire fraud and conspiracy to commit securities fraud.
sentences.chinese: 霍克西被控犯有网络欺诈罪及合谋进行证券欺诈。

sentences.english: Kulan is the result of the common conspiracy of the contemporary literature and its consumers.
sentences.chinese: 《库兰》是当代文学和其消费者共同合谋的结果。

sentences.english: Thesis further investigates theory the model of price of petroleum and conspires the fixed price.
sentences.chinese: 论文深入研究石油理论定价模型与合谋定价。

sentences.english: It shortens code length, and can counteract multi-collusion attacks.
sentences.chinese: 该方案不仅缩短了码长，而且可以抵抗多种合谋攻击。

sentences.english: Ep739 - Amy teams up with Mingming. They plan to clean out all the capital of Shijie Hotel.
sentences.chinese: 爱眉与明明合谋，计划掏空世界饭店的现金。

sentences.english: She asks him if he has conspired with his brother to scandalize her .
sentences.chinese: 她问他是否已与他的兄弟合谋，以谤她。

sentences.english: Some of the new employees are in cahoots with each other.
sentences.chinese: 有些新员工相互合谋共事。

sentences.english: The experts say most of us collude with those who lie to us.
sentences.chinese: 专家说，大多数人和向我们撒谎的人合谋。

definition: to collude with/to collaborate with/to gang up with
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to conspire to murder/to plot against sb's life
to conspire with sb/to plot/a conspirator/a partner in crime/an accomplice
villains collude together (idiom); to work hand in glove with sb (to nefarious ends)
to frame/to bring false charges against
to entrap/to set up/to frame (up)/to make false charges against
to have secret ties with/to be in covert communication with (the enemy etc)/to engage in an illicit sexual relationship/adultery
